author: Shayndi Raice
title: Prosecutor Drops Case Against Missouri Governor After Being Called as a Witness
text:
The St. Louis prosecutor who charged Missouri Gov. Eric Greitens with invasion of privacy for allegedly taking a nude photo of a woman after tying her up dropped the charges Monday after a judge allowed the defense to call her as a witness in the trial.
The Republican governor’s lawyers accused St. Louis Circuit Attorney Kimberly Gardner of misconduct, alleging that she allowed a lead investigator in the case to perjure himself. The judge granted the defense’s request to call Ms. Gardner as a witness, “placing her in an impossible... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
